DOC.brief_summary: This study aim determine whether increase atrial base rate pace achieve least 75-80 % atrial pacing patient sick sinus syndrome undergoing implementation dual-chamber pacemaker useful prevent decrease atrial fibrillation 6 month follow-up duration .
DOC.brief_title: Increasing Atrial Base Rate Pacing Reduce Atrial Fibrillation
DOC.criteria: Sick sinus syndrome patient dualchamber pacemaker Having paroxysmal AF define least 2 episode AHR/AMS > 190 b/min last > 6 minute Having normal atrioventricular conduction Other clinical indication pace except sick sinus syndrome ( bradycardiatachycardia syndrome ) History acute coronary syndrome Significant heart valve disease Chronic AF randomization Overt heart failure Malignancy Any reason antiarrhythmic medication use Inability follow patient every 3 month
